required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase IV, GSK2696273, Registry Study to Follow-up Patients With Adenosine Deaminase Severe Combined Immunodeficiency (ADA-SCID)
clinical_study.official_title: Adenosine Deaminase Severe Combined Immunodeficiency (ADA-SCID) Registry for Patients Treated With Strimvelis (or GSK2696273) Gene Therapy: Long-Term Prospective, Non-Interventional Follow-up of Safety and Effectiveness

brief_summary.textblock: Adenosine deaminase (ADA) enzyme deficiency results in severe combined immunodeficiency (SCID), a fatal autosomal recessive inherited immune disorder. Strimvelis (or GSK2696273) is a gene therapy intended for patients with ADA-SCID and for whom no suitable human leukocyte antigen (HLA) matched related stem cell donor is available. This therapy aims to restore ADA function in hematopoietic cell lineages, and in doing so prevents the pathology caused by purine metabolites (i.e., impaired immune function). This registry will evaluate the long term safety and effectiveness outcomes of subjects who have received Strimvelis (or GSK2696273).

primary_outcome.measure: Overall survival
primary_outcome.description: Number and causes of death and time of onset of fatal events will be summarized. Starting time will be the date of therapy administration.

primary_outcome.measure: Intervention free survival
primary_outcome.description: Intervention is defined as hematopoietic stem cell transplantation (HSCT) or >3 months of enzyme replacement therapy (ERT)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with the use of medications/treatments of interest
primary_outcome.description: Subjects requiring ERT, HSCT, radiotherapy or cytotoxic agents will be assessed

primary_outcome.measure: Absolute peripheral lymphocyte for Immune reconstitution assessment
primary_outcome.description: Peripheral lymphocyte will be assessed

primary_outcome.measure: Absolute cluster of differentiation (CD)3+ T-cell for Immune reconstitution assessment
primary_outcome.description: CD3+ T-cell counts will be assessed

primary_outcome.measure: Absolute CD19+ B-cell counts for Immune reconstitution assessment
primary_outcome.description: CD19+ B-cell counts will be assessed

primary_outcome.measure: Phytohaemagglutinin (PHA) and anti CD-3 as a measure for T cell function
primary_outcome.description: Phytohaemagglutinin (PHA) and anti CD-3 will be assessed

primary_outcome.measure: Growth percentile in body height
primary_outcome.description: Subject's height will be superimposed against gender specific World Health Organization (WHO) standard growth charts

primary_outcome.measure: Growth percentile in body weight
primary_outcome.description: Subject's weight will be superimposed against gender specific WHO standard growth charts

primary_outcome.measure: Deoxyadenosine nucleotides (dAXP) levels in red blood cells for the measurement of systemic metabolite detoxification
primary_outcome.description: Deoxyadenosine nucleotides (dAXP) levels will be assessed in red blood cells

primary_outcome.measure: Vector copy number measured in peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs)
primary_outcome.description: Vector copy number will be measured

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with severe infections
primary_outcome.description: Severe infection is defined as an infection requiring hospitalization or prolonging hospitalization

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with severe infections
primary_outcome.description: Severe infection is defined as an infection requiring hospitalization or prolonging hospitalization

primary_outcome.measure: Length of hospital stay
primary_outcome.description: Duration of the hospitalization will be monitored

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with non-immunological manifestations of ADA SCID
primary_outcome.description: Subjects will be examined for hepatic steatosis, cognitive deficits, behavioural abnormalities including suspected or diagnosed attention deficit hyperactivity disorder, autism, or hearing impairment

primary_outcome.measure: Pediatric development and quality of life data
primary_outcome.description: Determination of attendance at school, if appropriate for age; whether the child is in an age appropriate grade/class at school; whether the child requires special educational support (example [e.g.] dedicated tutor); participation in sports as desired by child; requirement for hearing aid(s); adequate response to childhood vaccinations; severity of impact of a child's health on the guardian's intended employment and Karnofsky/Lansky performance status

primary_outcome.measure: Scores for Pediatric Quality of Life Questionnaire (Peds-QL)
primary_outcome.description: The Peds-QL is a generic Health-Related Quality of Life (HR QoL) instrument designed specifically for a pediatric population. It captures the following domains: general health/activities, feelings/emotional, social functioning, school functioning. Higher scores indicate better quality of life (QOL) for all domains of the Peds-QL. This modular instrument uses a 5-point scale: from 0 (never) to 4 (almost always). Items are reversed scored and linearly transformed to a 0-100 scale as follows: 0=100, 1=75, 2=50, 3=25, 4=0. 4 dimensions (physical, emotional, social, & school functioning) are scored

primary_outcome.measure: Scores for Ages and Stages Questionnaire-3[ASQ-3]
primary_outcome.description: The ASQ-3 includes a series of questions designed to assess 5 areas of development: communication, gross motor, fine motor, problem solving, and personal social. The questions target behaviours that are appropriate for particular developmental milestones

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with adverse events of interest
primary_outcome.description: AEs & SAEs related to medical or surgical procedures, AEs & SAEs related to conditioning , hypersensitivity, autoimmunity, oncogenesis

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with any adverse events (AEs) and any serious adverse events (SAEs) as a safety measure
primary_outcome.description: AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a patient or clinical investigation subject, temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product. An AE can therefore be any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, or disease (new or exacerbated) temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product. Any untoward event resulting in death, life threatening, requires hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in disability/incapacity, congenital anomaly/birth defect or any other situation according to medical or scientific judgement will be categorized as SAE

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with abnormal clinical laboratory blood test results as a safety measure
primary_outcome.description: Biochemistry, hematology and TSH parameters were assessed

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with fertility and pregnancy related outcomes
primary_outcome.description: Labor and delivery information, full term pregnancy, caesarean section, abortion, miscarriage, ectopic, stillbirth rates will be assessed. Both male and female fertility issues will be analyzed.

primary_outcome.measure: Data from Retroviral Insertion Site (RIS) analysis and replication competent retrovirus (RCR)
primary_outcome.description: RIS and RCR will be performed when suspected malignancy or after a diagnosis of malignancy

arm_group.arm_group_label: ADA-SCID subjects treated with Strimvelis or GSK2696273
arm_group.description: Subjects with ADA-SCID who have received Strimvelis (or GSK2696273) gene therapy

intervention.description: GSK2696273 is a CD34+ cell enriched dispersion of human autologous bone marrow derived hematopoietic stem/progenitor cells transduced with a retroviral vector containing the human ADA gene. It will be administered as an intravenous infusion once only.
intervention.arm_group_label: ADA-SCID subjects treated with Strimvelis or GSK2696273

study_pop.textblock: This registry will include all subjects who have received Strimvelis (or GSK2696273) and consented to participate in the registry. A target number of fifty subjects will be enrolled in the registry.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria
- Subject with ADA-SCID, treated with Strimvelis or GSK2696273 as part of its clinical development program
- Adult subjects, or patients for whom their parents or legal guardians have signed the informed consent form for participation in the registry

overall_contact.last_name: US GSK Clinical Trials Call Center

contact.last_name: US GSK Clinical Trials Call Center

contact_backup.last_name: EU GSK Clinical Trials Call Center
